techmeme.title: Reddit will allow users to hide ads from their feeds from an advertiser account for "at least a year"; some users report seeing a daily limit for hiding ads (Scharon Harding/Ars Technica)
Morgan Marquis-Boire, the once-celebrated hacker accused of sexual assaults in 2017, is the undisclosed co-founder of crypto intelligence firm Unciphered (Joseph Menn/Washington Post)
The DOJ says Rostislav Panev, who is accused of being a key developer for the LockBit ransomware gang, has been extradited from Israel to the US (Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai/TechCrunch)
DocuSign stock jumps 14%+ after reporting Q4 revenue up 9% YoY to $776M, subscription revenue up 9% YoY, and a $83.5M net income, up from $27.2M a year ago (Laya Neelakandan/CNBC)
China announces new rules requiring companies to label AI-generated material, either explicitly or via metadata, starting September 1 (Debby Wu/Bloomberg)
